Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 23rd overall pick, by New Jersey in 1952...
Earned first career win on 6/4/1954...
Had first career hit on 7/7/1954, off John Pilskin (DIA)...
Injured on 9/26/1955 with a Ruptured Bicep Tendon, out for 8-9 weeks...
Hit first career homerun on 8/21/1956, off John Barahona (PIT)...
Signed as a free agent by Pittsburgh on 2/7/1959 to a 4-year deal worth $8,500,000 per year...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/21/1960, winning 2 games with a 0.95 ERA...
Injured on 4/5/1966 with a Sore Back, out for 1-2 weeks...
Drafted in 2nd round, 26th overall pick, by Longport in 1967...
Injured on 5/1/1968 with a Ruptured Bicep Tendon, out for 4-5 weeks...
Injured on 8/10/1968 with a Strained Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Injured on 5/7/1971 with a Strained Back, out for 1-2 weeks...
Traded from Longport to Coney Island on 3/2/1973 (Going to LP: C J. Lakey, P S. Archibald. Going to CI: P G. Chichester, P C. Morris)...
Earned first career win on 4/20/1975...
Signed as a free agent by West Texas on 2/11/1981 to a 3-year deal worth $10,830,000 per year...
Won Pitcher of the Month award on 8/1/1981, going 3-1, 0.86...
Signed as a free agent by Lynchburg on 5/12/1984 to a 1-year deal worth $1,900,000 per year...
Signed as a free agent by Columbus on 2/21/1985 to a 1-year deal worth $6,555,546 per year...
Had first career hit on 4/12/1985, off Antoine Shimizu (PG)...
Was selected to the 1985 Allstar game...
Signed as a free agent by Coney Island on 2/4/1986 to a 2-year deal worth $4,000,000 per year...
